author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Centre drew criticism from the Congress and the Aam Aadmi Party on Monday for allowing the visit of a Pakistani team to probe the Pathankot terror attack.

Delhi Chief Minister and Aam Aadmi Party convenor Arvind Kejriwal accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi of “surrendering to Pakistan” by allowing its investigators to conduct the probe. Congress chief spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala said “the BJP government has, for the first time… recognised that the Pakistani establishment does not have any role in perpetuating terror in India.”

The budget session of the Delhi assembly was adjourned for half an hour as the Aam Aadmi Party legislators staged a protest against the visit of Pakistani investigators. They wondered how Pakistan’s security and intelligence officials were being allowed to investigate something they had sponsored.
title: Modi has surrendered to Pak, says AAP
